content:
TITLE: Fitting Verbose Random Survival Forest Model in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to fit a Random Survival Forest model with verbose progress output and negation-based importance calculation. It uses the 'pbc' dataset and sets a specific number of trees.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ropensci/aorsf.git/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/verbosity.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
fit_verbose <- orsf(pbc, time + status ~ ., verbose_progress = TRUE, n_tree = n_tree_test,
importance = "negate")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Regression Coefficients with Newton-Raphson Scoring in R
DESCRIPTION: This equation demonstrates how regression coefficients are updated iteratively using the Newton-Raphson scoring method in the aorsf package. It uses the first and second derivatives of the coefficient vector to calculate the next iteration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ropensci/aorsf.git/blob/main/joss/paper.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
\hat{\beta}^{k+1} =  \hat{\beta}^{k} + U(\hat{\beta} = \hat{\beta}^{k})\, H^{-1}(\hat{\beta} = \hat{\beta}^{k})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fitting Verbose Random Survival Forest Model with Single Thread in R
DESCRIPTION: This code fits a Random Survival Forest model with verbose progress, negation-based importance, and explicitly sets the number of threads to 1. It demonstrates the output messages for growing trees, computing predictions, and importance.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ropensci/aorsf.git/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/verbosity.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
fit_verbose <- orsf(pbc, time + status ~ ., verbose_progress = TRUE, n_tree = n_tree_test,
importance = "negate", n_thread = 1)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Calculating Variable Importance for Verbose RSF Model in R
DESCRIPTION: This code calculates variable importance using the negation method for a previously fitted verbose Random Survival Forest model. It shows that the verbosity setting is carried over to subsequent operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ropensci/aorsf.git/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/verbosity.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
vi <- orsf_vi(fit_verbose_2, importance = "negate")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Performing Variable Selection on Verbose RSF Model in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet performs variable selection on a verbose Random Survival Forest model. It demonstrates that the verbosity setting is retained, showing a progress indicator for the selection process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ropensci/aorsf.git/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/verbosity.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
vs <- orsf_vs(fit_verbose)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Partial Dependence Plot for Verbose RSF Model in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates that the verbosity setting is retained in the fitted object. It generates a partial dependence plot for the 'island' variable using out-of-bag predictions from the previously fitted verbose model.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ropensci/aorsf.git/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/verbosity.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
pd <- orsf_pd_oob(fit_verbose, pred_spec_auto(island))
```
